Class MariaDbJpaConnection

java.lang.Object
ORM.datasource.MariaDbJpaConnection
public class MariaDbJpaConnection extends Object
Utility class for managing JPA connections to a MariaDB database.

Provides a centralized way to create EntityManager instances and manage the EntityManagerFactory lifecycle.

This class is a singleton utility: all methods are static, and the constructor is private to prevent instantiation.

Usage example: 

 EntityManager em = MariaDbJpaConnection.createEntityManager();
 try {
     // perform database operations
 } finally {
     em.close();
 }
 MariaDbJpaConnection.shutdown(); // call at application termination

  • Method Details

    • createEntityManager

      public static jakarta.persistence.EntityManager createEntityManager()
      Creates a new EntityManager instance.

      The caller is responsible for closing the EntityManager after use to avoid resource leaks.

      Returns:
      a new EntityManager connected to the MariaDB database

    • shutdown

      public static void shutdown()
      Performs a clean shutdown of the EntityManagerFactory and any shared EntityManager.

      This method should be called once at application termination to release all resources used by JPA.
